results.title: I spy. Total loss
results.creator_credit: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Two more fine tales from the vault of the master of the macabre. “I spy”: Pompous old Captain Morgan’s wife has up and left him, without so much as a note to let him know where she is. So he has hired private detective, Mr. Fruit to spy on her and see what she’s up to. Mr. Fruit poses as a waiter at the restaurant where she works and waits to see if she has found a gentleman friend… “Total loss”: A widow is left with a clothing business, but her head for business is no match for her sense of style. She is in debt and beginning to get desperate when she is tempted by an insurance scam…

results.title: Alfred Hitchcock presents
results.creator_credit: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley Productions
results.brief_description: The benign countenance of pudgy film director Alfred Hitchcock welcomed viewers to stories of terror, horror, suspense, and twisted endings for an entire decade. His clipped British accent and catlike theme music became symbols of Hitchcock’s black humour. The stories would often appear to end with evil triumphant, in strict violation of the television code of ethics. This situation was always resolved following the last commercial when Hitchcock would return to explain in his deadpan sardonic way, what silly mistake or chance occuurrence had finally done the villain in.

results.title: Night of the execution. Forty detectives later
results.creator_credit: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Two more twisted fables hosted by the master of the macabre. “Night of the execution”: A District Attorney, keen for political success and whose wife is more ambtious than he is, is desperate for a conviction in a murder trial he is prosecuting. So desperate, he is willing to do anything to send the defendant to the chair… anything. “Forty detectives later”: A man who claims he has found his wife’s murderer, hires his forty-first detective to wreak vengeance…

results.title: The Big score. Malice domestic.
results.creator_credit: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Another two macabre tales hosted by the master. “The Big score”: A deceitful baby-sitter sets up her delinquent friends for a heist of her trusting employer’s money. The evening ends in murder, but who is who in this twisted nightmare? “Malice domestic”: A writer who loves his wife’s cooking is incredulous when his doctor tries to tell him that his wife is trying to kill him. If only his dog could tell him what’s really going on.

results.title: The Last dark step; Flight to the East
results.creator_credit: Alfred J Hitchcock Productions and Shamley Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
The Last dark step: A fatal attraction has a ‘kept’ man unable to get out of a relationship with a disturbed girlfriend and marry a respectable girl. He is willing to do anything to get away, but she is willing to do anything to keep him. “Flight to the East”: When two strangers on a plane to Cairo meet, coincidence becomes too close for comfort for a man wrongly accused.

results.title: The Double headed eagle: Hitler's rise to power 1918-1933
results.creator_credit: Lutz Becker, David Puttnam, Sandy Lieberson, Argos Films and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: This extraordinary documentary charts the rise to power of Hitler and the Nazis, through the chaos of the Weimar republic. Rather than using voice-over narration the film relies on newsreels, home movie footage, and extracts from musicals and documentaries of the period to describe the state of German society during turbulent times. In doing so it reveals the disintegration of the old Germany and the advancement of the new, as represented by young Adolf Hitler and his peers. The film is broken into chapters, each dedicated to a different year during this period. Written by Lutz Becker and Philippe Mora. In German with English subtitles and captions.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Lutz Becker, David Puttnam, Sandy Lieberson, Argos Films and British Film Institute

results.title: Ocean Wanderers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
Second in a series on the wildlife of Macquarie Island. The film shows the life cycles of the Wandering Albatross, the Rockhopper Penguin, the Black Browed Albatross and the Grey Headed Albatross

results.title: The Dominant male
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
One of four films about Macquarie Island. In September giant elephant seals come to mate and pup. This program follows events at the largest harem on the island, with 1,500 cows and 50 males. Narrated by Sir Edmund Hillary, production and photography by David Parer.

results.title: Man the killer, man the keeper (D)
results.creator_credit: David Parer, ABC and Australia. Antarctic Division
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
First in a series of four films on the history and wildlife of Macquarie Island, 1,700 km South of Australia. The film shows man’s massive slaughter of the island’s seals and penguins for oil; the return after elimination 150 years ago of the New Zealand fur seal; stills and historical footage of the rape of the island’s resources, and a look at how the wildlife there is now being studied by the Antarctic division of the Australian Department of Science. Narrated by Sir Edmund Hillary. WARNING: CONTAINS SOME DISTURBING SCENES
